Question: What is the name of your VxRail Enterprise HCI project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this enterprise HCI infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What mission-critical infrastructure challenges require enterprise HCI?
Guidance: Common challenges: Tier 1 database performance, Business continuity, Aging SAN refresh, Complex DR orchestration, Multi-site deployments, Strict SLA requirements
Notes: Primary business driver for enterprise HCI investment

Question: What is your current enterprise infrastructure for mission-critical workloads?
Guidance: Describe hypervisor, enterprise SAN (EMC VMAX/Unity, NetApp, Pure), server count, and pain points

Question: How many virtual machines do you run for Tier 1 applications?
Notes: Determines cluster sizing and capacity planning

Question: What mission-critical workloads will you run on VxRail?
Guidance: Tier 1 workloads: Oracle RAC databases, SQL Server Always-On clusters, SAP HANA, SAP S/4HANA, Epic EHR, Cerner, Business intelligence platforms, Core banking systems

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying enterprise hyperconverged infrastructure?
Guidance: Common goals: Meet strict SLAs (99.99% uptime), Accelerate disaster recovery, Simplify multi-site operations, Reduce infrastructure costs, Eliminate SAN complexity, Enable micro-segmentation

Question: How will you measure enterprise VxRail HCI deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: SLA achievement (99.99%), RTO/RPO targets, database transaction performance, infrastructure cost reduction, DR failover time

Question: What uptime SLA must you achieve for mission-critical applications?
Guidance: Common targets: 99.9% (8.76 hours downtime/year), 99.95% (4.38 hours/year), 99.99% (52 minutes/year), 99.995% (26 minutes/year)

Question: What is your approved budget range for enterprise HCI infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $500K-$1M (8-node), $1M-$2M (12-16 node), $2M-$5M (24-32 node). Include both CapEx and OpEx

Question: Do you have multiple data centers for geographic distribution?
Guidance: Multi-site enables disaster recovery, compliance, and performance optimization

Question: How do you expect mission-critical workload growth over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current capacity and projected annual growth rate for Tier 1 applications

Question: What storage performance tier is required for mission-critical workloads?
Guidance: VxRail P570: All-NVMe for 100,000+ IOPS. VxRail V570: Hybrid NVMe+SSD for balanced performance
Notes: Storage tier selection and cost optimization

Question: What storage IOPS do your mission-critical databases require?
Guidance: Oracle RAC: 50,000+ IOPS typical. SQL Always-On: 30,000-100,000 IOPS. SAP HANA: 100,000+ IOPS

Question: What storage latency targets must you meet for Tier 1 applications?
Guidance: Common targets: <1ms for OLTP databases, <2ms for virtualized desktops, <5ms for general workloads

Question: What is your total usable storage capacity requirement for enterprise workloads?
Guidance: Include current usage plus 3-year growth. Common ranges: 100-200TB, 200-500TB, 500TB-1PB, 1PB+
Notes: vSAN capacity sizing (account for FTT=2 overhead)

Question: What level of hardware failure tolerance do you require?
Guidance: Options: FTT=1 (tolerate 1 node failure, minimum 4 nodes), FTT=2 (tolerate 2 node failures, minimum 6 nodes). Enterprise typically requires FTT=2
Notes: vSAN failure tolerance policy and cluster sizing

Question: What cluster size is optimal for your enterprise deployment?
Guidance: Common: 8-node (balanced), 12-16 node (high performance), 24-32 node (scale-out)

Question: What deduplication and compression ratios do you expect?
Guidance: vSAN Enterprise: 2-3:1 typical for VMs, 3-5:1 for VDI. Lower ratios for databases (pre-compressed data)

Question: What database platforms require high performance?
Guidance: Common: Oracle Database 12c/19c, Microsoft SQL Server 2016-2022, SAP HANA, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra

Question: Do you run Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC)?
Guidance: Oracle RAC requires low-latency shared storage. vSAN all-NVMe recommended for RAC performance
Notes: Oracle RAC certification and performance validation

Question: Do you run SQL Server Always-On Availability Groups?
Guidance: SQL Always-On benefits from low-latency storage and high IOPS for synchronous replication
Notes: SQL Server optimization and storage policies

Question: Do you run SAP HANA or S/4HANA in-memory databases?
Guidance: SAP HANA requires all-NVMe with strict latency requirements. VxRail P570 certified for SAP HANA
Notes: SAP HANA certification and TDI compliance

Question: What total RAM capacity is required for in-memory databases?
Guidance: SAP HANA nodes: 1.5TB-3TB per node. Large database VMs: 512GB-1TB per VM

Question: What VMware version requirements do you have for enterprise features?
Guidance: VxRail ships with vSphere 8. Enterprise needs DRS, HA, vMotion, Fault Tolerance
Notes: Version compatibility and enterprise feature requirements

Question: What network connectivity is required for vSAN and vMotion?
Guidance: VxRail P570 uses 25GbE for vSAN. Consider 100GbE for very large databases and high vMotion traffic

Question: Do you need VMware NSX for micro-segmentation and network virtualization?
Guidance: NSX enables East-West firewall for database security and zero-trust architecture
Notes: NSX Data Center licensing and architecture

Question: What disaster recovery solution do you require?
Guidance: Options: VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM), vSAN stretched cluster, Dell RecoverPoint for VMs, Zerto
Notes: DR solution selection and RPO/RTO requirements

Question: What are your Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO)?
Guidance: Mission-critical: RTO <15 minutes, RPO <5 minutes. Consider synchronous replication for RPO near-zero

Question: Do you need vSAN stretched cluster for active-active DR?
Guidance: Stretched cluster: Zero RPO, automated failover. Requires <5ms RTT latency between sites

Question: What enterprise backup solution do you use?
Guidance: Common: Dell EMC PowerProtect Data Manager (PPDM), Veeam, Commvault, Rubrik, Cohesity, IBM Spectrum Protect

Question: What backup window and throughput requirements apply?
Guidance: Enterprise backup: Complete within 4-8 hour window. Consider Changed Block Tracking (CBT) for incrementals
Notes: Backup target sizing and network capacity

Question: What is the highest data classification for enterprise applications?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted, PII/PHI, PCI cardholder data, CUI/ITAR
Notes: Determines encryption and access control requirements

Question: Do you require encryption at rest for mission-critical data?
Guidance: vSAN encryption with external KMS required for compliance (FIPS 140-2 validated)

Question: What key management solution will you use for vSAN encryption?
Guidance: Options: VMware vCenter Native KMS, HashiCorp Vault Enterprise, Thales CipherTrust Manager, AWS CloudHSM (hybrid)

Question: What compliance standards must the enterprise infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common: SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, HIPAA, PCI DSS Level 1, FedRAMP High, NIST 800-53, GDPR, CMMC Level 3

Question: Do you need application-level micro-segmentation for zero-trust?
Guidance: NSX-T micro-segmentation enables granular firewall policies between database tiers
Notes: NSX deployment and security policy design

Question: Do you need distributed IDS/IPS for East-West traffic?
Guidance: NSX Distributed IDS/IPS inspects lateral movement and threats between VMs

Question: Do you require DISA STIG compliance for government workloads?
Guidance: VMware provides STIG hardening guides. VxRail supports STIG-compliant ESXi configuration

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have for compliance?
Guidance: Requirements: vCenter audit logs, ESXi shell access logs, vSAN health logs, Configuration change tracking, Integration with SIEM
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: What uptime SLA must you guarantee for mission-critical applications?
Guidance: Enterprise SLA: 99.99% (52 min downtime/year), 99.995% (26 min/year). Requires FTT=2 and redundant infrastructure
Notes: HA architecture and SLA contractual obligations

Question: Can you tolerate planned downtime for maintenance?
Guidance: vSAN and vSphere support rolling updates with zero downtime. VxRail Lifecycle Manager automates patching

Question: Do you need vSAN fault domains for rack-level failure protection?
Guidance: Fault domains: Protect against entire rack failure (power, network, cooling). Requires 3+ fault domains

Question: Do you have a secondary data center for disaster recovery?
Guidance: DR site enables business continuity. Distance and latency affect replication technology choice

Question: What DR failover approach do you require?
Guidance: Options: Manual failover (RPO hours), Automated failover with SRM (RPO <15 min), Synchronous stretched cluster (RPO zero)

Question: How frequently do you test disaster recovery failover?
Guidance: Compliance often requires quarterly or annual DR tests. SRM enables non-disruptive testing

Question: Do you need replication between 3+ sites?
Guidance: Multi-site enables: DR to secondary, backup to tertiary. RecoverPoint for VMs supports many-to-many

Question: What application-level HA do you use?
Guidance: Application clusters: Oracle RAC, SQL Always-On, Kubernetes, Pacemaker/Corosync. Complements infrastructure HA

Question: What centralized management platform do you use?
Guidance: Options: vRealize Operations (vROps), vRealize Suite, Third-party (SolarWinds, PRTG), Dell OpenManage Enterprise

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required for mission-critical infrastructure?
Guidance: Enterprise monitoring: Real-time dashboards, Predictive analytics, Capacity planning, Performance anomaly detection

Question: Do you use infrastructure automation or orchestration?
Guidance: Tools: Ansible Tower, Terraform Enterprise, VMware vRealize Automation, PowerCLI scripts

Question: What ITSM platform do you use for ticketing?
Guidance: Common: ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, Jira Service Management. Integration for automated incident creation

Question: What Dell support coverage do you require for mission-critical?
Guidance: Mission Critical Services: 2-hour response 24x7 with on-site parts. ProSupport Plus: 4-hour response
Notes: Support SLA and cost tradeoff for Tier 1 apps

Question: Do you need dedicated technical account manager (TAM)?
Guidance: TAM provides proactive support, quarterly reviews, escalation management for enterprise customers

Question: How do you manage capacity planning for growth?
Guidance: vRealize Operations provides capacity planning and what-if analysis. Plan 18-24 months ahead for CapEx

Question: What performance management processes are in place?
Guidance: Database performance monitoring: Real-time query analysis, Storage I/O profiling, CPU/memory trending

Question: Do you need operational runbooks for VxRail enterprise operations?
Guidance: Enterprise runbooks: Incident response, Escalation procedures, Disaster recovery, Change management, Compliance audits

Question: Do you have 24x7 operations staff for monitoring?
Guidance: 24x7 NOC: Proactive monitoring and incident response. Automation reduces staffing needs

Question: What is the planned VxRail deployment size?
Guidance: Typical enterprise: 8-12 node pilot, 24-32 node production. Staged deployment reduces risk

Question: What pilot workloads will you use to validate VxRail enterprise platform?
Guidance: Non-production databases, development environments, or lower-tier applications for validation

Question: What is your timeline for migrating mission-critical workloads?
Guidance: Phased migration: Pilot 1-2 months, production tiers 3-6 months. Oracle RAC requires careful planning

Question: What database migration approach will you use?
Guidance: Options: vMotion (VMware-to-VMware zero downtime), Storage vMotion, Backup/restore, Oracle Data Guard failover
Notes: Database migration tools and downtime windows

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for Tier 1 migrations?
Guidance: Mission-critical: Minimal or zero downtime required. Use vMotion or application-level HA for cutover

Question: What training is required for VxRail enterprise administration?
Guidance: Advanced training: vSAN specialist, NSX professional, vRealize Operations, VxRail lifecycle management
Notes: Knowledge transfer scope and certification paths

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy Enterprise Services?
Guidance: ProDeploy Enterprise: Architecture design, installation, migration services, knowledge transfer
Notes: Dell professional services and engagement scope

Question: What performance testing is required before production go-live?
Guidance: Database benchmarks: TPC-C equivalent, Oracle SLOB, SQL Server DiskSpd, SAP HANA certification tests

Question: What concerns do you have about enterprise HCI complexity?
Guidance: VxRail simplifies operations but still requires VMware expertise. Training and support critical

Question: What could cause mission-critical migration to fail?
Guidance: Database migration risks: Performance degradation, Compatibility issues, Downtime overruns, Data corruption

Question: How will you validate performance meets Tier 1 SLAs?
Guidance: Pilot testing, benchmarking, and gradual production cutover validate performance before full commitment

Question: What are your current enterprise SAN and server costs?
Guidance: Include: EMC/NetApp maintenance, server support, power, rack space, admin labor for enterprise storage
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: What would legacy SAN refresh cost vs VxRail HCI?
Guidance: Enterprise SAN refresh: $1M-$3M for equivalent capacity. Compare to VxRail all-inclusive model

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting for enterprise HCI?
Guidance: Enterprise HCI TCO benefits: 18-36 month payback typical. Operational simplification delivers ongoing value
